translations.english_saheeh: Exalt the name of your Lord, the Most High,
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. Glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most High,
translations.english_rwwad: Glorify the name of your Lord, the Most High,

translations.english_hilali_khan: Who has created (everything), and then proportioned it.
translations.english_rwwad: Who created and fashioned in due proportion,

translations.english_hilali_khan: And Who has measured (preordainments for everything even to be blessed or wretched); and then guided (i.e. showed mankind the right as well as the wrong paths, and guided the animals to pasture).
translations.english_rwwad: and Who determined [the creation] then guided them,

translations.english_saheeh: And who brings out the pasture
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Who brings out the pasturage,
translations.english_rwwad: and Who brings forth the pasture,

translations.english_hilali_khan: And then makes it dark stubble.
translations.english_rwwad: then makes it into withered chaff.

translations.english_saheeh: We will make you recite, [O Muḥammad], and you will not forget,
translations.english_hilali_khan: We shall make you to recite (the Qur’ân), so you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) shall not forget (it),
translations.english_rwwad: We will teach you [the Qur’an], so you will not forget,

arabic_text: إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ يَعۡلَمُ ٱلۡجَهۡرَ وَمَا يَخۡفَىٰ
phonetic: 87.7 'Illā Mā Shā'a Allāhu 'Innahu Ya`lamu Al-Jahra Wa Mā Yakhfá

translations.english_saheeh: Except what Allāh should will. Indeed, He knows what is declared and what is hidden.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except what Allâh may will. He knows what is apparent and what is hidden.
translations.english_rwwad: except what Allah wills, for indeed He knows what is manifest and what is hidden.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1907]- To the path of Allāh's religion, which is easy and natural, or toward Paradise, by giving opportunities for righteous deeds.

translations.english_saheeh: And We will ease you toward ease.[1907]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We shall make easy for you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) the easy way (i.e. the doing of righteous deeds).
translations.english_rwwad: We will guide you to the easy way.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1908]- i.e., wherever it will be heard and understood.

translations.english_saheeh: So remind, if the reminder should benefit;[1908]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therefore remind (men) in case the reminder profits (them).
translations.english_rwwad: So remind, if the reminder should benefit.

translations.english_saheeh: He who fears [Allāh] will be reminded.
translations.english_hilali_khan: The reminder will be received by him who fears (Allâh),
translations.english_rwwad: He who fears Allah will take heed,

translations.english_saheeh: But the wretched one will avoid it
translations.english_hilali_khan: But it will be avoided by the wretched,
translations.english_rwwad: but the wretched will avoid it,

translations.english_saheeh: [He] who will [enter and] burn in the greatest Fire,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Who will enter the great Fire (and will be made to taste its burning).
translations.english_rwwad: who will enter the Great Fire,

arabic_text: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحۡيَىٰ
phonetic: 87.13 Thumma Lā Yamūtu Fīhā Wa Lā Yaĥyā

translations.english_hilali_khan: There he will neither die (to be in rest) nor live (a good living).
translations.english_rwwad: wherein he will neither die nor live.

translations.english_saheeh: He has certainly succeeded who purifies himself
translations.english_hilali_khan: Indeed whosoever purifies himself (by avoiding polytheism and accepting Islâmic Monotheism) shall achieve success,
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, he who purifies himself will attain success,

translations.english_saheeh: And mentions the name of his Lord and prays.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And remembers (glorifies) the Name of his Lord (worships none but Allâh), and prays (five compulsory prayers and Nawâfil - additional prayers).
translations.english_rwwad: and remembers his Lord’s Name and prays.

translations.english_saheeh: But you prefer the worldly life,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nay, you prefer the life of this world,
translations.english_rwwad: But you prefer the life of this world,

translations.english_saheeh: While the Hereafter is better and more enduring.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Although the Hereafter is better and more lasting.
translations.english_rwwad: even though the Hereafter is better and more lasting.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, this is in the former scriptures,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, this is in the former Scriptures -
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, this was in the earlier Scriptures,

translations.english_saheeh: The scriptures of Abraham and Moses.
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Scriptures of Ibrâhîm (Abraham) and Mûsâ (Moses) (عليهما السلام).
translations.english_rwwad: the Scriptures of Abraham and Moses.
